title: All hail the power of Jesus' name

author.name: Edward Perronet
author.bio: Edward Perronet was an English hymnwriter and clergyman of the Church of England. He is best known for writing the famous hymn 'All Hail the Power of Jesus' Name'. Perronet was a close associate of John and Charles Wesley and George Whitefield, leaders of the early Methodist movement. Despite his association with the Wesleys, Perronet occasionally had differences with them regarding the administration of sacraments by lay preachers. Eventually, he departed from the Methodist movement to minister within the Countess of Huntingdon's Connexion and later led an independent congregation. Throughout his life, Perronet published a number of hymns and poems, leaving a lasting legacy through his contributions to Christian hymnody.

lyrics:
All hail the power of Jesus' name!
Let Angel’s prostrate fall;
Bring forth the Royal diadem
And crown Him Lord of all.

Crown Him, ye Martyrs of our God,
Who from His altar call;
Extol the stem of Jesse's rod,
And crown Him Lord of all.

Ye chosen seed of Israel’s race,
A remnant weak and small,
Hail Him who saves you
By His grace,
And crown Him Lord of all.

Ye Gentile sinners, ne'er forget
The wormwood and the gall;
Go, spread your trophies
At His feet
And crown Him Lord of all.

Let every kindred, every tribe,
On this terrestrial ball,
To Him all Majesty ascribe,
And crown Him Lord of all.

Oh, that with yonder
Sacred throng,
We at His feet may fall;
Join in the everlasting song,
And crown Him Lord of all.
